s.text: It turns government suggestions into veiled threats and devalues true voluntarism.
Even though 90 percent of all new bunk beds sold conform to the voluntary standards, Newsday reported last month that the commission's staff is now recommending mandatory standards.
A stickup artist shoves a Smith & Wesson in your face: Your money or your life, he says, by which he means you can surrender your money or you can surrender your slightly bloody money and your life.
Observers gave Kennedy's bill little chance of passing, but Seagram found itself flummoxed anyway.
